basics.name: Aubrie Usui
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.  My desired field/career I want to work towards is Hawaiian Airlines IT department.

education.project: Link Up Manoa Project: Created a web application with a few classmates with the purpose of making it easier to create study groups with people in similar classes or majors.  I developed the friends page as well as half of the reminders page.  I was in charge of the front and back-end engineering of the two pages. I used mostly Semantic UI React with some CSS and HTML.
courses: Intro to Computer Science I & II

work.summary: Worked with team to improve and create a web application called InternBit.  Helped create design mockups of the pages we would implement into the application as well as code the front and back-end of the app.  The goal of the app is to create an easier way for students to find an internship without looking on a million websites.

Advised and assisted customers in using the complex, coinless card system. Offered hands-on assistance to customers, assessing needs and maintaining current knowledge of consumer preferences. Provided exceptional customer service and responded to customer concerns in a friendly and knowledgeable manner

Worked with athletes to improve coordination through strategic drills and confidence.  Collaborated with Head Coach on the most effective workouts, player discipline, and performance analysis. Developed a relationship with each and every athlete on the team, helping each to succeed based on their individual strengths and weaknesses

Answered phone calls, accommodate customers’ special needs, and ensured that service was quick and efficient.  Prepared beverages and desserts based on customers’ preference.  Closed and opened restaurant according to restaurant procedures and policies, took inventory of supplies and money in registers.  I learned to team building skills as I picked up some slack from coworkers if they were slammed with orders and helped grab shipments or extra supplies when we needed them.

volunteer.summary: The Loʻi is a Hawaiian term meaning taro patches.  Taro is a type of plant that is very common for Hawaiians to grow and was one of the main foods they ate.  I volunteer here on every first Saturday of the month to help with whatever the leaders tell me to do.  My duties would include stomping in the mud to bury the leaves, re-mmounding the mud piles around the kalo plants, or collecting leaves to put into the patches.  It is very humbling and teaches me team work as well as patience.

ITMA is a student organization at UH Manoa focused on information technology and business combined.  My position is under the Director of Marketing and I help him create flyers for the club to post on social medias and t-shirt designs.

awards.title: Division 1 Athletic Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to athletes who perform well and scores points at the conference as well as hold a good GPA.
